title: Cohuna celebrates the coronation of QE II
creator_contributor_role: Cohuna Historical Society Productions, production company
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Cities and towns
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Victoria - Description and travel
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Victoria - Social life and customs
abstract: Cohuna celebrates the Coronation of Queen Elizabeth II in 1952.
description: When Cohuna Higher Elementary School wanted to raise money for a film projector, local resident Tom Olsson decided to help by filming life in the township and surrounding countryside, and then showing the footage in the local Town Hall. His footage has been lovingly compiled by the Cohuna Historical Society and the resulting films give us a special glimpse into rural life in 1950's Victoria. The school recieved their projector, and Olsson's films were shown annually as a Christmas treat for many years afterward. This segment documents the QEII Coronation parade in 1952.
